oaidtb.boosters
Class AdaBoostOC

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--weka.classifiers.Classifier
        |
        +--weka.classifiers.DistributionClassifier
              |
              +--oaidtb.boosters.Booster
                    |
                    +--oaidtb.boosters.AdaBoostOC
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, ErrorUpperBoundComputer, IterativeUpdatableClassifier, weka.core.OptionHandler, java.io.Serializable, weka.core.WeightedInstancesHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdaBoostECC
public class AdaBoostOC
extends Booster
implements ErrorUpperBoundComputer

Class for boosting using Schapire's AdaBoostOC. For more information, see

Robert E. Schapire. Using output codes to boost multiclass learning problems. In Machine Learning: Proceedings of the Fourteenth Internatinal Conferences, pages 313-321, 1997.

Version:
$Revision: 1.0 $
Author:
Santiago David Villalba Bartolomé
See Also:

protected int[] m_OriginalDataClasses
Original training instance belongs to class... {m_NumInstances}-->[0,m_NumClasses)

m_Classifiers

private WeightedClassifierVector m_Classifiers
We store the base classifiers and their weights dynamically. I choose this approach instead of using a faster fixed length array because I want to be able of control interactively the number of performed iterations (next method...).

m_Max_U_CalculatingIterations

protected int m_Max_U_CalculatingIterations
Number of retries in the task of find a good coloring (which maximizes U).

The number of classes.

The theoretical training error upper bound.

m_LastDistributionWeightSumBeforeNormalize

protected double m_LastDistributionWeightSumBeforeNormalize
A variable where we store the weights distribution sum before normalizing it; needed to compute the traininh error upper bound of Asymmetric AdaBoostECC, but we put it here because it hasn't any performance penalization.

calculateU

protected double calculateU()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Calculate U; this method calls m_Coloring.newPartition to generate a new binary split of the label set until it obtains U>=0.5 or has generated m_Max_U_CalculatingIterations partitions; it´s a little refined, blind way (it hopes for the m_Coloring to have a good partition method) to do this.
Returns:
Maximum U obtained in the way described.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if it has any problems with the "coloring class".

relabel

protected void relabel()
Relabel the training data according to the coloring function calculated in calculateU. Equivalent to (but more efficient than) m_TrainData=Filter.useFilter(OriginalData, m_Coloring)

reweight

protected void reweight(double u)
Assign a new weight to every instance in the training dataset according to U and its associated mislabel distribution.
Parameters:
u - U calculated by Schapire's formulae

calculatePseudoLoss

private double calculatePseudoLoss(weka.classifiers.Classifier baseClassifier)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Calculate base classifier's pseudoloss. Extract from Schapire's paper:

This loss measure penalizes the weak hypothesis for failing to include the correct label y(i) in the plausible set associated with example x(i)...,and further penalizes each incorrect label l != y(i) which is included in the plausible set.

This is here applicated to the class partition previously generated, so that the plausible set is the set of classes which belongs to the same partition (0 or 1) in which the base classifier predicts each instance is in.
Parameters:
baseClassifier - From which calculate the error.
Returns:
The base classifier error related to the training data.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If base classifier can´t classify a training instance.

calculateClassifierWeight

private double calculateClassifierWeight(double epsilon)
Calculate the base classifier weight related to its error. If the error is greater than 0.5, the classifier produces a negative vote for the class in which it clssifies an instance, which is nearly the same effect of taking the inverse of such classifier (remember, it's a binary classification problem).
Parameters:
epsilon - Classifier's error.
Returns:
Classifier´s weight.

calculateMislabelDistribution

protected void calculateMislabelDistribution(weka.classifiers.Classifier baseClassifier,
                                             double beta)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Update the "mislabel distribution, with respect to the last base classifier generated and its weight.
Parameters:
baseClassifier - The classifier from we obtain the fresh new information.
beta - The weight of the currente classifier.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If it fails.

Returns:
1 for true, 0 for false.

inSet

protected boolean inSet(int set,
                        int clase,
                        int iteration)
Is the class "clase" in the set "set" in the partition "iteration"?. There is no error (parameter) control.
Parameters:
set - The subset of the partition (either 1 or 0).
clase - The class.
iteration - The partition number.
Returns:
true if class belongs to the set, otherwise false

updateTrainingErrorUpperBound

private void updateTrainingErrorUpperBound(double pseudoLoss,
                                           double u)
Update the training error upper limit; the training error of the final combined hypothesis is theoretically guaranteed to be under this value.
Parameters:
pseudoLoss - The pseudoloss of the last base classifier trained.
u - U associated to the last coloring computed & base classifier trained.

setOptions

public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Parses a given list of options. Valid options are:

 -F classname
 Specify a class (must be an AbstractNominalToOCFilter subclass) for
 compute the coloring with.


 -U numIterations
 Set the number of retries searching for a coloring function producing U>=1/2.
 (default 1)


 -B
 Calculate the training error upper bound (default false).

 Plus the rest of the superclass options.
Overrides:
setOptions in class Booster
Parameters:
options - the list of options as an array of strings
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if an option is not supported
